Typedef Documentation

typedef struct _PSMoveFusion PSMoveFusion

Handle to a PS Move Fusion object.

Obtained via psmove_fusion_new()

Function Documentation

void psmove_fusion_free ( PSMoveFusion *  fusion)

Destroy an existing fusion instance and free allocated resources.

Parameters
fusionA valid PSMoveFusion handle
float* psmove_fusion_get_modelview_matrix ( PSMoveFusion *  fusion,
PSMove *  move 
)

Get a pointer to the 4x4 model-view matrix for a controller.

This function returns the OpenGL model-view matrix for one motion controller. The coordinate system origin is at the center of the sphere, aligned with the controller. The returned matrix therefore describes both the position and orientation of the controller in 3D space. Usually the return value can be loaded directly into the GL_MODELVIEW matrix of the user application using glLoadMatrix().

Parameters
fusionA valid PSMoveFusion handle
moveA valid PSMove handle
Returns
A pointer to a 16-item (4x4) float array representing the modelview matrix for the controller. The return value is only valid as long as the PSMoveFusion object exists, the caller MUST NOT free() the return value.
void psmove_fusion_get_position ( PSMoveFusion *  fusion,
PSMove *  move,
float *  x,
float *  y,
float *  z 
)

Get the 3D position of a controller.

This function returns the 3D position (relative to the camera) of the motion controller, based on the current projection matrix.

Parameters
fusionA valid PSMoveFusion handle
moveA valid PSMove handle
xA pointer to store the X part of the position vector
yA pointer to store the Y part of the position vector
zA pointer to store the Z part of the position vector
float* psmove_fusion_get_projection_matrix ( PSMoveFusion *  fusion)

Get a pointer to the 4x4 projection matrix.

This function returns the OpenGL projection matrix for the camera used. Usually the return value can be loaded directly into the GL_PROJECTION matrix of the user application using glLoadMatrix().

Parameters
fusionA valid PSMoveFusion handle
Returns
A pointer to a 16-item (4x4) float array representing the current projection matrix. The return value is only valid as long as the PSMoveFusion object exists, the caller MUST NOT free() the return value.
PSMoveFusion* psmove_fusion_new ( PSMoveTracker *  tracker,
float  z_near,
float  z_far 
)

Create a new PS Move Fusion object.

Creates and returns a new PSMoveFusion object.

Parameters
trackerThe PSMoveTracker instance from which position information should be obtained
z_nearThe Z coordinate of the near clipping plane
z_farThe Z coordinate of the far clipping plane
Returns
A new PSMoveFusion handle or NULL on error
